intro: Bunias cochlearioides, commonly known as the curly dock, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its broad, wavy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist soils along roadsides and in disturbed areas. Bunias cochlearioides is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
